# Task

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.



# Data

q_and_a_extractor("# Question
What is the capital of France?

# Answer
The capital of France is Paris.
")

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = RegexMatchIterator(r"## Question\n([^\n]+)", md)
    answers = RegexMatchIterator(r"## Answer\n([^\n]+)", md)
    
    # Extract the text from each question and answer section
    questions_text = [match.captures[1] for match in questions if match !== nothing]
    answers_text = [match.captures[1] for match in answers if match !== nothing]
    
    # Ensure there is a corresponding answer for each question
    if length(questions_text) != length(answers_text)
        throw(ErrorException("The number of questions does not match the number of answers."))
    end
    
    # Strip leading spaces and newlines from the text
    questions_stripped = strip.(questions_text)
    answers_stripped = strip.(answers_text)
    
    # Return the tuple with the questions and answers
    return (questions_stripped[1] => answers_stripped[1]), # We assume there is only one question and answer pair
end
```
